FuncDef:
The pki whitelist capacity warning-threshold command configures an alarm threshold for the number of configured whitelists.
The undo pki whitelist capacity warning-threshold command cancels the alarm threshold configuration for the number of configured whitelists.
By default,the alarm threshold is 90% for the number of configured whitelists.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an alarm threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 80 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 90.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In whitelist-based IPsec certificate authentication scenarios, to configure an alarm threshold for the number of configured whitelists, run the pki whitelist capacity warning-threshold command. When the percentage of the number of configured whitelists in the whitelist specification (20000) is greater than or equal to the alarm threshold, an alarm is generated. When the percentage of the number of configured whitelists in the whitelist specification (20000) falls below the alarm threshold, the alarm is cleared.
